title: Functional vs Non-Functional Requirements
subject: Software Engineering
theory:
- **Functional (FR)**: What system DOES. (e.g., System shall send email, Login, Calculate tax).
- **Non-Functional (NFR)**: How system BEHAVES. (e.g., Performance, Security, Scalability, Portability).

examples.code:
FR: Button clicks -> Page opens.
NFR: Page opens in < 2 seconds.

common_mistakes.correction: System works but slow/insecure. Client rejects it. NFRs are Constraints.

interview_questions.question: Is usability an FR or NFR?
interview_questions.answer: NFR. It describes quality of interaction.
